xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 14 March 2014
xwikidoc.content: <gauravsaini03> has joined #phenotips 02:55 <Guest38811> has joined #phenotips 02:56 <Guest38811> is now known as <spark3> 02:58 <spark3> has quit 02:58 <spark3> has joined #phenotips 03:17 <spark3> has quit 03:40 <spark3> has joined #phenotips 06:08 <CARAM> has quit 06:10 <spark3> has quit 06:21 <spark3> has joined #phenotips 07:13 <SayAsh> has joined #phenotips 07:21 <spark3> has quit 07:21 <spark3> has joined #phenotips 07:46 <spark3> has quit 09:46 <akats> has joined #phenotips 10:12 <gauravsaini03> has quit 10:21 <bvancea> has joined #phenotips 10:42 <SayAsh> has quit 10:45 <SayAsh> has joined #phenotips 11:24 <SayAsh> has quit 11:39 <SayAsh_> has joined #phenotips 11:51 <sdumitriu> Hey bvancea 11:52 <bvancea> hey sdumitriu 11:52 <bvancea> what's up? 11:55 <gauravsaini03> has joined #phenotips 11:55 <sdumitriu> Just got back to the office, catching up 11:55 <bvancea> I see :) 11:56 <bvancea> I pushed another commit to my pull request, not sure I got the correct field for the groups. Check when you have time :P 11:56 <sdumitriu> Yep 11:57 <bvancea> I'm currently thinking of what analytics I can do for the GSOC project 11:59 <bvancea> Seems like xwiki has some nice charts modules which can be used for graphs and stuff 11:59 <sdumitriu> Yes 12:00 <sdumitriu> That started as my first GSoC 12:00 <bvancea> I see 12:01 <bvancea> I found two official ones, but this Charting plugin seems to wrap the charting macro extension. 12:01 <bvancea> Any of them your work? 12:03 <sdumitriu> Any "plugin" is deprecated 12:03 <sdumitriu> And there are two macros 12:04 <sdumitriu> One is a Radeox macro, which is also deprecated 12:04 <sdumitriu> And one is a wiki macro 12:04 <sdumitriu> The plugin and older macro were mine 12:05 <sdumitriu> The new one is more limited in what it supports, though 12:05 <bvancea> I see 12:08 <bvancea> Well, the only one I found that is modified in 2014 is this one: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Chart+Macro 12:08 <sdumitriu> Yes, that's the new one 12:09 <bvancea> I see 12:09 <bvancea> cool 12:09 <bvancea> :D 12:21 <sdumitriu> has quit 12:23 <bvancea> has quit 13:38 <SayAsh_> has quit 14:10 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 14:13 <CARAM> has quit 14:32 <sdumitriu> has quit 14:37 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 14:42 <akats> Autosave.js didn't overwrite the default one. Could you check if I put it in the right folder? The default is in resources/js/xwiki/editors/ and I put my file in distribution/war/src/main/webapp/resources/js/xwiki/editors/ 14:43 <sdumitriu> Remove webapp 14:45 <akats> It's good 14:45 <akats> You can pull 14:45 <sdumitriu> Works lovely :) 14:46 <sdumitriu> You didn't push 14:47 <sdumitriu> Or wait... 14:48 <sdumitriu> Removing webapp is wrong, it should work like this 14:50 <akats> Oh yeah, hard refresh struck again. 14:53 <CARAM> has quit 15:25 <bvancea> has joined #phenotips 15:47 <CARAM> has quit 15:49 <CARAM> has quit 16:05 <gauravsaini03> has quit 16:19 <mcupak> has quit 16:36 <bvancea> hey sdumitriu 16:36 <sdumitriu> Hey bvancea 16:36 <bvancea> I noticed you we're working on the Medsavant integration for phenotips 16:37 <bvancea> how does phenotips store variant information for patients? 16:37 <sdumitriu> It doesn't, right now it relies on MedSavant 16:37 <bvancea> hm 16:38 <bvancea> but it doesn't store any information at all, like what variants are associated with what patient? 16:38 <bvancea> or are the patient records shared with medsavant? 16:53 <CARAM> has quit 16:53 <akats> has left #phenotips 16:54 <akats> has joined #phenotips 16:56 <akats> sdumitriu: Can I use data-bind in the UI? I want to put the object id of the remote server configuration into the data-bind when it is shown to the user in the list of available search engines. 16:58 <akats> has quit 18:44 <CARAM> has quit 18:54 <sdumitriu> bvancea: No, MedSavant stores all the information about variants 18:55 <bvancea> I see. 18:55 <sdumitriu> What our bridge does instead is make sure the patient's external ID is the same as the sample ID in the VCF when uploading 18:56 <bvancea> So do we want to be able to manually assign variants to patients? Or just to parse the VCF files ? 19:21 <bvancea> has quit 23:06 <sdumitriu> is now known as <sdumitriu_[Away]>
